intro: Moraea britteniae, commonly known as the Britten's moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces sword-shaped leaves and has a short, stout stem. Moraea britteniae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
